alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Henry; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:20AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, southeastern Delaware and northeastern Henry Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 520 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Muncie, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Randolph, southeastern Delaware and northeastern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Summit Lake State Park, Prairie Creek Reservoir, Blountsville, Mooreland, Losantville and Modoc. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
